text: Doing a redundant `atoi` after you just did `strtol` is probably the most twisted insult to the proper use of string-to-int conversion functions in C one can come up with. Why do you see the need to "re-convert" the value using the broken function `atoi` when you already have it as `val` from a proper function `strtol`?
augmented_text: Ultra polite: "Forgive me if I'm mistaken, but wouldn't strtol be a tad more efficient than atoi in this instance? Please correct me if I'm wrong."
